  | mouth_elevation =  discharge = watershed = 
}} ]] The 'Cuyahoga River' United States Geological Survey Hydrological Unit
Code: 04-11-00-02 ( , or ) is located in Northeast Ohio in the
United States and feeds Lake Erie. Outside of Ohio, the river is most famous for
being "the river that caught fire," helping to spur the environmental movement
in the late 1960s. Native Americans called this winding water "Cuyahoga," which
means "crooked river" in an Iroquoian language.
